body.p:
Louisville February 1st 1861.
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky.

I have before me a letter from my kind friend Judge Mason Brown saying that he handed my letter to your Excellency, That you received and read it with much kindness and politeness and requested me to call your attention to the subject on the first of February. I now sincerely hope your Excellency will mercifully grant the promised pardon to Patrick Donnelly. His anxious mother counts the hours that still separate her from her child. I shall ever gratefully remember how kindly and courteously you received the
Petition last Summer.
Hoping your Excellency will now show that clemency we so much desire I remain
